Docs.summary: The GUILayout class is the interface for Unity gui with automatic layouting.

MemberSignature.Value: public GUILayout ();

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float HorizontalScrollbar (float value, float size, float leftValue, float rightValue, UnityEngine.GUILayoutOption[] options);

Docs.summary: Make a hopriztonal scrollbar. Scrollbars are what you use to scroll through a document. Most likely, you want to use scroll views instead.
Docs.returns: float - the modified value. This can be changed by the user by dragging the scrollbar, or clicking the arrows at the end.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float HorizontalScrollbar (float value, float size, float leftValue, float rightValue, UnityEngine.GUIStyle style, UnityEngine.GUILayoutOption[] options);

Docs.returns: float - the modified value. This can be changed by the user by dragging the scrollbar, or clicking the arrows at the end.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float VerticalScrollbar (float value, float size, float topValue, float bottomValue, UnityEngine.GUILayoutOption[] options);

Docs.summary: Make a vertical scrollbar. Scrollbars are what you use to scroll through a document. Most likely, you want to use scrollViews instead.
Docs.returns: float - the modified value. This can be changed by the user by dragging the scrollbar, or clicking the arrows at the end.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float VerticalScrollbar (float value, float size, float topValue, float bottomValue, UnityEngine.GUIStyle style, UnityEngine.GUILayoutOption[] options);

Docs.summary: Make a vertical scrollbar. Scrollbars are what you use to scroll through a document. Most likely, you want to use scrollViews instead.
Docs.returns: float - the modified value. This can be changed by the user by dragging the scrollbar, or clicking the arrows at the end.

MemberSignature.Value: public static UnityEngine.Rect Window (int id, UnityEngine.Rect screenRect, UnityEngine.GUI.WindowFunction func, string text, UnityEngine.GUILayoutOption[] options);

Docs.summary: Make a popup window that layouts its contents automatically.
Docs.returns: - the rectangle the window is at. This can be in a different position and have a different size than the one you passed in.
